person.note: Fan(2) Zuyu [7026] Posthumously purged as Yuanyou coalition member. Baizhi's [7217] son, Bailu's [578] and Baijia's [3283] nephew, Chong(1)'s [562] father, Lu(9) Gongzhu's [1314] son-in-law. His wife's cousin was Han(1) Zhongyan's [644] wife. Accused by Liu(2) Cheng [1178] in 1094-97. XCB, 413.11a-14b, 429.6a, 503.11a. Bailu was buried in Luoyang, his uncle, Zhen(2) [3279], died in his private residence in Xuzhou (Henan), but was buried in Ruzhou, Xiangcheng county as were his sons, Baijia [3283] and Baisui [16764]. Some of Bailu's sons were Chengdu, Huayang residents and some of Zuyu's grandsons as well as grandnephews (great grandsons of Bailu) became Zhengdu, Huayang residents, where as others moved elsewhere. I am moving both Bailu to Luoyang and identifying his younger brother Baizhi as a Luoyang resident as well as Zuyu and Zuyu's sons. I am identifying Zhen(2) as a person who moved to Xuzhou and his sons, Baikui [13776], Baisui, Baijia and Bailu [3284] as Xuzhou residents. His great grandson, Yuangong [16790] (used zi, mingzi, Gui), was also a Xuzhou resident. All other kin will be given address of record, if given, or Chengdu, Huayang address if none other recorded. CBD, 2, 1763-5.
